title.narrative: Lekie North Integrated Sheep and Goat Production for Sustainable Livelihoods

description.narrative: The Lekie North Integrated Sheep and Goat Production for Sustainable Livelihoods Project will serve the Lieke Division of the Centre Region of Cameroon within a 160-mile radius of the Heifer Cameroon Program Zone Office in Yaoundé. This project will assist a total of 1,800 farm families over its duration. Initially, it will assist 300 original families with 1,500 sheep/goats (five sheep/goats per farm family). These original families will pass on the same number of sheep/goats to another 1,500 farm families (one sheep/goat per farm family). The original families will also provide training and follow-up to the POG families to ensure the project’s sustainability. At least 60 percent of the project participants will be women and other disadvantaged persons. The project will train farmers in Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones, group development and management, improved animal and crop husbandry, integrated crop-livestock techniques, market gardening, post-harvest management and enterprise development. Farmers will receive related agricultural materials/supplies and other farm inputs to enable them to build up production assets. The project will sensitize families on prevention of HIV/AIDS and facilitate access to voluntary counseling and testing. Project staff will also mainstream gender equity in the implementation of project activities. The project participants will provide land, labor and on-farm materials for animal pen construction.

"Train farmers on Heifer’s 12 cornerstones, group development and management, improved animal and crop husbandry, integrated crop-livestock techniques, market gardening, post-harvest management and enterprise development.
